alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 2:11PM MDT until May 14 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following areas, Bighorn Mountains Southeast, Northeast Johnson County and Southeast Johnson County. * WHEN...From 6 PM MDT this evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Around 1 to 1.5 inches of rainfall are possible overnight Wednesday into much of Thursday through Friday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. This heavier rainfall could cause rivers or streams to rise out of their banks.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
